m_szDocTitle: New iJET Solar Cell is as Easy to Make as Pizza | CleanTechnica
m_szDocSumamry: New iJET Solar Cell is as Easy to Make as Pizza October 5th, 2008 by Andrew Williams Â  An Australian scientist has developed a new method of manufacturing solar cells using nothing more than some nail polish remover, a pizza oven and a standard inkjet printer. The iJET technique is so easy and cheap to carry out that it could revolutionize access to solar technology in the developing world. In a recent radio interview (audio) , Nicole Kuepper, a 23 year-old PhD student at the University of New South Wales, explained the process. Firstly, she takes a standard silicon solar  cell and sprays it w
